comment._content:
It is still there.  However the Building that photo was taken from is no longer there.  It is a parking lot.  

Still a store in that spot too.

comment._content: Great things you do, i mean all the project. Keep it on!

comment.author: 60987721@N00
comment._content:
Check it out in MSN live maps Warren Ave and Pleasant.

Enter "warren avenue and pleasent st, brockton, ma" into the MSN live maps, go to the birdseye view and you can see a nice shot of the building. It is the one on the right...

comment.author: 88069407@N00
comment._content: Thanks for the map info mfmcdougall and rrsafety, that was fun actually seeing that building as it is today.

comment.author: 51092719@N00
comment._content: I remember that little market on the corner of North Warren Avenue and Pleasant Street in Brockton. But more important -- to me -- is the building from which the shot was taken. As #4 (Meaghan) says, it's no longer there. But it was there after WWII, when my late stepfather came back from the South Pacific. It was a rooming house and he rented there.

comment.author: 51092719@N00
comment._content:
Just a comment: the "7264" people see on the market's door is not its address. This is right at the start of North Warren Avenue, so it's number would be something like "10."

That "7264" -- actually, I think it's "72<u>5</u>4" -- is an ad. I vaguely recall it as a brand of cigar, though I can't find anything on the Internet to confirm it.

comment.author: 10951005@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called The Original Plymouth Colony, and we'd love to have your photo added to the group.
